title: $20 million NASA mission to visit 'God of Chaos' asteroid saved from budget cuts in last-minute decision
summary: NASA's OSIRIS-APEX mission, which was one of 19 designated to be canceled by the Trump administration, has been saved from the chopping block in a last-minute decision. There will be a significant change to its structure, however.

title: Orionids 2025: Meteor shower caused by Halley's Comet peaks as two new comets cross the sky
summary: Comets Lemmon and SWAN will be at their brightest just as the annual Orionid meteor shower produced by Halley's Comet reaches its peak.

title: How to See Comet Lemmon This October
summary: This long-duration comet will make its closest approach to Earth this fall, before disappearing into the outer solar system for another 1,000 years.

title: CO2 levels reach record new high, locking in more global warming
summary: Greenhouse gas concentrations increased by a record amount in 2024 as more carbon dioxide, methane and nitrous oxide became locked in Earth's atmosphere, a World Meteorological Organization report finds.

title: An Iranian volcano appears to have woken up — 700,000 years after its last eruption
summary: Taftan volcano near the border of Pakistan has shown signs of unrest in recent years.

title: Record-breaking 'dark object' found hiding within a warped 'Einstein ring' 10 billion light-years away
summary: Researchers have found a suspected clump of dark matter lurking within the luminous halo of a well-known "Einstein ring." The mysterious object, the smallest of its kind ever seen, could help shed light on the universe's missing matter.

title: 'Most pristine' star ever seen discovered at the Milky Way's edge — and could be a direct descendant of the universe's first stars
summary: Astronomers have discovered a surprisingly "pristine" red giant with the lowest concentration of heavy elements ever seen in a star. It is likely a direct descendant of one of the universe's first stars.

title: Chasing comets: How to photograph comets Lemmon and 3I/ATLAS
summary: Comets don't visit often — here's how to capture comet Lemmon, comet 3I/ATLAS, on your camera as they dance across our skies.

title: James Webb telescope finds something 'very exciting' shooting out of first black hole ever imaged
summary: Using the James Webb Space Telescope's infrared camera, scientists have captured the gigantic jet blasting out of M87* in a new light.

title: Haunting image of a rare hyena lurking in a ghost town wins 2025 Wildlife Photographer of the Year award
summary: South African photographer Wim van den Heever has received this year's Wildlife Photographer of the Year award for his image of a brown hyena outside a ruined diamond mining town.

title: Astronomers spot the most powerful and distant 'odd radio circle' ever seen
summary: With help from citizen scientists, astronomers have found the most powerful and distant "odd radio circle" ever detected.

title: A massive weak spot in Earth's magnetic field is growing, scientists discover
summary: The South Atlantic Anomaly, a huge weak spot in the geomagnetic field off South America, has expanded and sprouted a lobe in the direction of Africa over the past decade.

title: Link between Cascadia and San Andreas Fault earthquakes discovered 30 years after lost vessel stumbled across key data
summary: Geological records hint that earthquakes at the Cascadia subduction zone might trigger the San Andreas Fault.

title: 'Planet Y' theory hints at hidden Earth-size world lurking in the solar system — and it could be much closer to us than 'Planet Nine'
summary: A new study has proposed the existence of Planet Y, an alternative Planet Nine candidate that is smaller and closer to Earth than the hypothetical Planet X, which astronomers have been hunting for almost a decade. However, the evidence for this newly theorized world is "not definitive."

title: Hidden 'doomed' star revealed by James Webb Space Telescope could solve decades-old mystery
summary: Researchers have identified a massive red supergiant on the brink of supernova in images from the James Webb Space Telescope, shedding light on a decades-old star mystery.

title: An 'ice tsunami' in 2024 ripped through the Yukon with such force it tore up trees and the riverbed
summary: Chunks of river ice tore down trees after a landslide caused a tsunami in the Yukon in December.

title: $100,000 quadrillion asteroid Psyche may be the product of metal volcanoes, study hints
summary: The metal-coated asteroid Psyche may have had eruptions of molten iron and nickel on its surface. This situation was more likely if the space rock is made of the same chemicals as metal-rich meteorites, a new study suggests.

title: Scientists 'reawaken' ancient microbes from permafrost — and discover they start churning out CO2 soon after
summary: Researchers incubated permafrost samples from Alaska at different temperatures and found that microbes from the last ice age can reactivate and resume breaking down carbon.

title: What if Christopher Columbus had never reached the Americas?
summary: How would history have unfolded if Christopher Columbus had never reached the New World?

title: Physicists capture rare illusion of an object moving at 99.9% the speed of light
summary: For the first time, physicists have simulated what objects moving near the speed of light would look like — an optical illusion called the Terrell-Penrose effect.

title: Hubble went supernova hunting — and found something unexpected: Space photo of the week
summary: The Hubble Space Telescope reveals how color filters tease out the life cycles of stars in spiral galaxy NGC 6000 — while a surprise asteroid streaks through the frame.

title: العناني أول مصري وعربي يتولى رئاسة اليونسكو.. والسيسي يهنئه
summary: ‏‎انتخب المجلس التنفيذي لمنظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة (اليونسكو) بأغلبية ساحقة خالد العناني مرشح مصر لمنصب مدير عام المنظمة، وذلك خلال الانتخابات التي جرت الإثنين، حسبما أفاد المتحدث باسم الخارجية المصرية.

title: من المرشح المصري الأوفر حظا لقيادة اليونسكو؟
summary: يجرى الإثنين تصويت حاسم للمجلس التنفيذي لليونسكو، منظمة الأمم المتحدة للتربية والعلوم والثقافة، بهدف اختيار المدير العام المقبل، في خطوة تكتسب أهمية فائقة، إذ سيتولى الفائز قيادة المنظمة لـ4 سنوات وسط اتهامها بأنها "مسيسة"، وفي ظل الارتباك الذي أحدثه إعلان الولايات المتحدة خروجها منها.

title: إغلاق قناة "ناصر".. وأسرة عبد الناصر تتحرك لإنقاذ الأرشيف
summary: أقدمت منصة "يوتيوب" على إغلاق قناة "Nasser TV (ناصر تي في)" التي كانت تبث تسجيلات نادرة للرئيس المصري الراحل جمال عبد الناصر، في خطوة أثارت تفاعلًا واسعًا خلال الساعات الماضية، وسط سعي أسرته لاستعادتها أو البحث عن بدائل لنشر باقي تسجيلاته النادرة.
